column3: Latest;Phnom Penh: The Ministry of Health announced on the morning of Thursday
column6: four more COVID-19 cases had been discovered. The latest patients are reported to be Cambodian men who had arrived from from Russia and Indonesia in July. ------Meanwhile
column7: three more patients were treated and released from hospital. Updates to follow.------Three men transited from Russia to Malaysia and arrived in Cambodia on July 19. The sixth test was made on August 12
column8: and the result was positive. ------* 26-year-old man resides in Khan Sen Sok
column9: Phnom Penh------* 30-year-old man resides in Siem Reap City
column10: Siem Reap Province------* 30-year-old man resides in Sampov Loun District
column12: the three men were being isolated at a training center in Kampong Speu province
column13: and are now being treated at Kampong Speu Provincial Referral Hospital.------The fourth man returned from Indonesia on July 23
column15: which came back positive.------He is a 27-year-old man living in Krouch Chhmar district
column17: was a passenger from Indonesia on a flight to Cambodia on July 23
column18: 2020.------His fifth test result was positive for Kovid-19 virus on August 12
column20: and he is currently being treated at Preah Norodom Sihanouk Hospital in Suong City
column21: Tbong Khmum Province.------Cambodia has confirmed a total of 272 cases and treated a total of 223 cases.
